title: Tuolumne Peak
text:
Tuolumne Peak is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, in <a href="Yosemite%20National%20Park">Yosemite National Park</a>, in the area of <a href="Tuolumne%20Meadows">Tuolumne Meadows</a>. It is a <a href="fractured%20granite">fractured granite</a>, <a href="twin%20summited">twin summited</a> peak, and is close to geographic center of the park. Tuolumne Peak is located approximately northeast of <a href="Mount%20Hoffmann">Mount Hoffmann</a> via a granite <a href="ridge-line">ridge-line</a>. It is climbed less often than Hoffman, probably due to a more difficult approach.
The mountain is in <a href="Mariposa%20County">Mariposa County</a>.
There is <a href="rock%20climbing">rock climbing</a>, on Tuolumne Peak.
<a href="Tenaya%20Glacier">Tenaya Glacier</a> had effects, at least near Tuolumne Peak, during the <a href="Wisconsin%20Glacial%20Stage">Wisconsin Glacial Stage</a>, over-topping the ridge that connects Tuolumne Peak to Mount Hoffman, isolating both tops.
